A sort of triangle inequality.

type:
‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_2} [inst : LinearOrder Œ±] [inst_1 : LocallyFiniteOrder Œ±] {a b c : Œ±},
  Finset.uIcc a c ‚äÜ Finset.uIcc a b ‚à™ Finset.uIcc b c
name: Finset.uIcc_subset_uIcc_union_uIcc
docString: A sort of triangle inequality.

In any pseudo metric space, the distance from x to y is less than or equal to the sum of the distances from z to x and z to y (triangle inequality).

type: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : PseudoMetricSpace Œ±] (x y z : Œ±), dist x y ‚â§ dist z x + dist z y
name: dist_triangle_left
docString: In any pseudo metric space, the distance from x to y is less than or equal to the sum of the distances from z to x and z to y (triangle inequality).

This theorem, known as the Triangle Inequality, applies to any pseudometric space. For any three points `x`, `y`, and `z` in this space, it asserts that the distance from `x` to `z` is less than or equal to the sum of the distances from `x` to `y` and from `y` to `z`. This is a fundamental property of distances in many mathematical spaces, including, for example, the Euclidean distance in real and complex spaces.

type: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : PseudoMetricSpace Œ±] (x y z : Œ±), dist x z ‚â§ dist x y + dist y z
name: dist_triangle
docString: This theorem, known as the Triangle Inequality, applies to any pseudometric space. For any three points `x`, `y`, and `z` in this space, it asserts that the distance from `x` to `z` is less than or equal to the sum of the distances from `x` to `y` and from `y` to `z`. This is a fundamental property of distances in many mathematical spaces, including, for example, the Euclidean distance in real and complex spaces.

The angle between three points is zero if and only if one of the first and third points is
weakly between the other two, and not equal to the second.

type:
‚àÄ {V : Type u_1} {P : Type u_2} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup V] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù V] [inst_2 : MetricSpace P]

  EuclideanGeometry.angle p‚ÇÅ p‚ÇÇ p‚ÇÉ = 0 ‚Üî p‚ÇÅ ‚â† p‚ÇÇ ‚àß Wbtw ‚Ñù p‚ÇÇ p‚ÇÅ p‚ÇÉ ‚à® p‚ÇÉ ‚â† p‚ÇÇ ‚àß Wbtw ‚Ñù p‚ÇÇ p‚ÇÉ p‚ÇÅ
name: EuclideanGeometry.angle_eq_zero_iff_ne_and_wbtw
docString:
The angle between three points is zero if and only if one of the first and third points is
weakly between the other two, and not equal to the second.

For all real numbers x, y, and z with x ‚â• 1 and y ‚â§ z, x^y ‚â§ x^z.

type: ‚àÄ {x y z : ‚Ñù}, 1 ‚â§ x ‚Üí y ‚â§ z ‚Üí x ^ y ‚â§ x ^ z
name: Real.rpow_le_rpow_of_exponent_le
docString: For all real numbers x, y, and z with x ‚â• 1 and y ‚â§ z, x^y ‚â§ x^z.

This theorem is a statement of the triangle inequality in the context of pseudometric spaces. Given any pseudometric space `Œ±` and any three points `x`, `y`, `z` within that space, the distance between `x` and `y` is always less than or equal to the sum of the distance between `x` and `z`, and the distance between `y` and `z`. This is a fundamental property of distance in many geometric and algebraic structures.

type: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u} [inst : PseudoMetricSpace Œ±] (x y z : Œ±), dist x y ‚â§ dist x z + dist y z
name: dist_triangle_right
docString: This theorem is a statement of the triangle inequality in the context of pseudometric spaces. Given any pseudometric space `Œ±` and any three points `x`, `y`, `z` within that space, the distance between `x` and `y` is always less than or equal to the sum of the distance between `x` and `z`, and the distance between `y` and `z`. This is a fundamental property of distance in many geometric and algebraic structures.

docString: The diagonal $\Delta(X) \subseteq X \times_Y X$.

name: quotient_norm_add_le
docString: The quotient norm satisfies the triangle inequality.

less than the slope of the secant line of `f` on `[x, z]`, then `f` is convex.

The triangle `Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ‚ü¶1‚üß` given by an octahedron.

type:
{C : Type u_1} ‚Üí
  [inst : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C] ‚Üí
    [inst_1 : CategoryTheory.Preadditive C] ‚Üí
      [inst_2 : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroObject C] ‚Üí
        [inst_3 : CategoryTheory.HasShift C ‚Ñ§] ‚Üí
          [inst_4 : ‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñ§), CategoryTheory.Functor.Additive (CategoryTheory.shiftFunctor C n)] ‚Üí
            [inst_5 : CategoryTheory.Pretriangulated C] ‚Üí
              {X‚ÇÅ X‚ÇÇ X‚ÇÉ Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ Z‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ : C} ‚Üí
                {u‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ : X‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂ X‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí
                  {u‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ : X‚ÇÇ ‚ü∂ X‚ÇÉ} ‚Üí
                    {u‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ : X‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂ X‚ÇÉ} ‚Üí
                      (comm : CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp u‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ u‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ = u‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ) ‚Üí
                        {v‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ : X‚ÇÇ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí
                          {w‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ : Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ ‚ü∂ (CategoryTheory.shiftFunctor C 1).obj X‚ÇÅ} ‚Üí
                            {h‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ :
                                CategoryTheory.Pretriangulated.Triangle.mk u‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ v‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ w‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ ‚àà
                                  CategoryTheory.Pretriangulated.distinguishedTriangles} ‚Üí
                              {v‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ : X‚ÇÉ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ} ‚Üí
                                {w‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ : Z‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ ‚ü∂ (CategoryTheory.shiftFunctor C 1).obj X‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí
                                  {h‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ :
                                      CategoryTheory.Pretriangulated.Triangle.mk u‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ v‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ w‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ ‚àà
                                        CategoryTheory.Pretriangulated.distinguishedTriangles} ‚Üí
                                    {v‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ : X‚ÇÉ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ} ‚Üí
                                      {w‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ : Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ ‚ü∂ (CategoryTheory.shiftFunctor C 1).obj X‚ÇÅ} ‚Üí
                                        {h‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ :
                                            CategoryTheory.Pretriangulated.Triangle.mk u‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ v‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ w‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ ‚àà
                                              CategoryTheory.Pretriangulated.distinguishedTriangles} ‚Üí
                                          CategoryTheory.Triangulated.Octahedron comm h‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ h‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ h‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ ‚Üí
                                            CategoryTheory.Pretriangulated.Triangle C
name: CategoryTheory.Triangulated.Octahedron.triangle
docString: The triangle `Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ ‚ü∂ Z‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ‚ü¶1‚üß` given by an octahedron.

`f` on `[x, y]` is less than the slope of the secant line of `f` on `[x, z]`.

The angle between three points is zero if and only if one of the first and third points is
strictly between the other two, or those two points are equal but not equal to the second.

type:
‚àÄ {V : Type u_1} {P : Type u_2} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup V] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù V] [inst_2 : MetricSpace P]

name: EuclideanGeometry.angle_eq_zero_iff_eq_and_ne_or_sbtw
docString:
The angle between three points is zero if and only if one of the first and third points is
strictly between the other two, or those two points are equal but not equal to the second.

In a strictly convex space, the triangle inequality turns into an equality if and only if the
middle point belongs to the segment joining two other points.

type:
‚àÄ {V : Type u_1} {P : Type u_2} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup V] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ‚Ñù V]
  [inst_2 : StrictConvexSpace ‚Ñù V] [inst_3 : MetricSpace P] [inst_4 : NormedAddTorsor V P] {a b c : P},
  dist a b + dist b c = dist a c ‚Üî Wbtw ‚Ñù a b c
name: dist_add_dist_eq_iff
docString:
In a strictly convex space, the triangle inequality turns into an equality if and only if the
middle point belongs to the segment joining two other points.

independent if and only if the other is.

**Ptolemy's inequality**: in a quadrangle `ABCD`, `|AC| * |BD| ‚â§ |AB| * |CD| + |BC| * |AD|`. If
`ABCD` is a convex cyclic polygon, then this inequality becomes an equality, see
`EuclideanGeometry.mul_dist_add_mul_dist_eq_mul_dist_of_cospherical`.

type:
‚àÄ {V : Type u_1} {P : Type u_2} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup V] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù V] [inst_2 : MetricSpace P]
  [inst : NormedAddTorsor V P] (a b c d : P), dist a c * dist b d ‚â§ dist a b * dist c d + dist b c * dist a d
name: EuclideanGeometry.mul_dist_le_mul_dist_add_mul_dist
docString:
**Ptolemy's inequality**: in a quadrangle `ABCD`, `|AC| * |BD| ‚â§ |AB| * |CD| + |BC| * |AD|`. If
`ABCD` is a convex cyclic polygon, then this inequality becomes an equality, see
`EuclideanGeometry.mul_dist_add_mul_dist_eq_mul_dist_of_cospherical`.
